Infant feeding and HIV in emergencies 
In the interest of overall child survival, introducing replacement feeding or early cessation of 
breastfeeding is unlikely to be a safe option in most emergency situations. In countries that 
recommend EBF with ARVs for HIV-infected mothers, the recommendation should remain 
unchanged, even if ARVs are temporarily not avail
